summary: The bill, titled the "Small Lenders Exempt from New Data and Excessive Reporting Act" (also known as the Small LENDER Act), amends the Equal Credit Opportunity Act. It aims to provide small financial institutions with a three-year period to comply with new data collection rules, followed by a two-year safe harbor from penalties. The bill defines "financial institution" based on small business loan origination and defines "small business" based on gross annual revenues. This concerns the Bureau's final rule regarding small business lending data collection.
